title: Calories in a Pint of Guinness
meta_description: Discover calories in a pint guinness, including carbs, protein, and full nutrition breakdown per serving, plus tweaks and FAQs for beer lovers.
h1: Calories in a Pint of Guinness
assumptions: Standard Guinness Draught stout, 568 ml UK pint serving, poured from tap or can, no added flavors or mixers.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand variant, serving size, alcohol content, and pouring method. Check labels or brewery info when available.

quick_answer.text: A pint of Guinness provides ~210 kcal, mostly from carbs with minimal protein and no fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add a splash of milk for creaminess

faqs.q: How many calories in a pint of Guinness?
faqs.a: Approximately 210 kcal for a standard 568 ml pint.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a pint Guinness?
faqs.a: About 18 g of carbohydrates, with 0 g fiber and sugars.

faqs.q: Is Guinness low in fat or protein?
faqs.a: Yes, 0 g fat and ~2 g protein per pint.

faqs.q: How does Guinness compare to other beers calorie-wise?
faqs.a: Similar to many stouts at ~210 kcal per pint, but lighter lagers may be 150-200 kcal.

faqs.q: Does the alcohol content affect calories in Guinness?
faqs.a: Yes, at 4.2% ABV, it contributes to the 210 kcal total via carbs and ethanol.
